analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi
translated: The reverse order of the dependent origination, the text of the Paṭṭhāna according to the Triad method
The triad of the wholesome, the dyad of the pervaded

original: Nakusalaṁ napariyāpannaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato pariyāpanno dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Naakusalaṁ napariyāpannaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato pariyāpanno dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: na kusalam na pariyāpannam dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ pariyāpannaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā  na akusalam na pariyāpannam dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ pariyāpannaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an unwholesome, unpervaded, state as condition, an indeterminate, pervaded, state arises, a condition being by way of root condition.🔽With a non-wholesome, unpervaded, state as condition, an indeterminate, pervaded, state arises, a condition being by way of root condition.

original: Naabyākataṁ napariyāpannaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato pariyāpanno dhammo uppajjati
analyzed: na abyākatam na pariyāpannam dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ pariyāpannaḥ dhammo uppajjati
translated: With a non-indeterminate, unpervaded, state as condition, an indeterminate, pervaded, state arises, a condition being by way of root condition.

original: hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā pañca, adhipatiyā pañca …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate pañca.🔽Nakusalaṁ naapariyāpannaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā kusalo apariyāpanno dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā pañca adhipatiyā pañca pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate pañca  na kusalam na apariyāpannam dhammam paccayā kusalaḥ apariyāpannaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: (In brief.) As root cause there are five, as predominance there are five, … as kamma result there are three, … as non-hindrance there are five.🔽With a wholesome, unpervaded, state as condition, a wholesome, unpervaded, state arises, a condition being by way of root cause.

original: Nakusalaṁ naapariyāpannaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā abyākato apariyāpanno dhammo uppajjati
analyzed: na kusalam na apariyāpannam dhammam paccayā abyākataḥ apariyāpannaḥ dhammo uppajjati
translated: With a wholesome, unpervaded, state as condition, an indeterminate, unpervaded, state arises, a condition being by way of root cause.

original: hetupaccayā … dve. (Akusalamūle dve, dukamūle dve.) Hetuyā cha … vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate cha.
analyzed: hetu paccayā dve akusala mūle dve duka mūle dve hetuyā cha vipāke tīṇi pe avigate cha
translated: With cause as condition … two. (With the unwholesome roots, two. With the two roots, two.)
